Parole.definition: a conditional release of a prisoner who has served part of a sentence and who remains under the control of and in the legal custody of a parole authority compare probation
Parole.origin: [Old French, speech, word, prisoner's word of honor to fulfill stated conditions, from Late Latin parabola speech, parable, from Greek parabolÄ“ comparison]

1.1: a conditional release of a prisoner who has served part of a sentence and who remains under the control of and in the legal custody of a parole authority compare
